newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian miners block trains in wage protest.
newsitem.headline: Russian miners block trains in wage protest.

text.p: Miners from the northern Russian city of Inta blocked railroad traffic connecting coal pits with the city in a protest over wages, local police said on Sunday.

"The action is a warning and will be renewed if there is no reaction from the government of the Komi region and Russia," Interfax news agency quoted Vladimir Nikolayenko, head of the region's coal miners' union, as saying.
A police spokesman said some miners marched in Inta to demand the payment of back wages.

In Vorkuta, also part of the Komi region about 1,800 km (1,125 miles) northeast of Moscow, job protests have halted all coal mining, although some workers are still loading trains with coal that was mined earlier, a city official said by telephone.
Seven people were staging a hunger strike, said the duty official at the Vorkuta city administration.
The remote northern region on the Arctic Circle has been hit by a series of protests and strikes of recent as miners have sought to recover back wages dating back as long as a year.
Coal companies say they are unable to pay salaries because they have not been received money from companies buying the coal.
